column5: Test being done to see what's up for Radiation, Friday was my 1st Scan at St Jos, Monday was an Ultra Sound of Kidney, Liver & Bladder at New Vic & Tuesday was a CT with contrast at University Hospital, now I'm waiting until Feb 16 to talk to the Doctor to find out what's next & when it all starts, Tight Lines Richard
Big kick in the ass that's for sure. Good luck and keep a positive attitude. You can beat this s.......t!!!
Good Luck. Like everyone else said, kick it in the ass you can beat this crap.
Keep smilin Richard.. it's a cure in itself!!
A bit blindsided by your post, had no idea you were battling this.  Keep the faith, you can do it man.
I wish you all the best success in your fight.

Best of luck from here in O/S! Been there, no how much that big "C" word terrorizes you when the doctor first says it. I was lucky, it was caught very early and even though I required major surgery and have a permanent colostomy, I did not require chemo or radiation. It been 7 years this month. Hang in there and keep a positive outlook.
Thanks for the update Richard - rooting for ya bud - you can beat this thing
Keep it up brother... Lots of support here for ya!
Rooting for you Richard! Keep it up and never lose sight of the finish line
Best of luck to you Richard.

It can be beat Richard, you are proof of that!  It's nice to see the support you are getting from this OFC. It's not often I post on threads like this but recently thought of how you would know we are always thinking of everyone that has had a tough time in their lives.  Cheers, Ron...
